info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 4:40PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN MERCER COUNTY THROUGH 515 PM EDT... At 440 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Kinsman, or 11 miles north of Sharpsville, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Greenville, Clark, and Jamestown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for northwestern Pennsylvania.
